column4: i cant seem to connect via sftp to the other pc on my LAN. i have an exception in firestarter. could anyone help me?
is ssh listening on the other pc?
im not sure what does "listening" entail?
sftp depends on a listening ssh server. the ssh server is not installed by default, so you might have to install that first
that is installed
ok, so you can 'ssh' into your machine?
no.
hmm okay, are you sure sshd (the server) is running? The output of 'netstat -tnl | grep 22' should answer this
back. i saw a couple of lines beginning with tcp, and a couple beginning with tcp6 but no ssh
actually just one line beginning with tcp6
sounds like ssh is not running then. Are you sure it's installed? 'sudo apt-get install ssh' to install the server (the client is there already by default)
it's already installed
try 'sudo service ssh start'
Job is already running: ssh
and you can not ssh into this machine from another on your network? Do you have a firewall configured that is blocking incoming port 22?
it appears SSH events keep coming up in my firestarter log even though I have exceptions for that machine
still, it seems that requests are blocked anyhow by firestarter. i suggest looking into config of firestarter again
i've looked several times and i have all the exceptions I could possibly need. what could be wrong with it?
nevermind. i have it now
thanks for your help :)
you're welcome
